entry.title: A simple utility script to combine two JSON files together
entry.summary: So I have been working on some REST API and JSON. One of the task that had to be done was how to manage multiple people editing a single API data point. So I came up with an idea of splitting a single JSON API data file into multiple files called “fragments”. Each “fragment” will hold a smaller amount of data created by a single author or contributor. The fragments will always adhere to the JSON data schema of course. Here’s an example of a JSON file as the API data. This fragment is named api-data.json

entry.title: PUSH Festival, Art and Access Recap
entry.summary: The PUSH festival held an interesting conversation on Friday, Jan. 25th, 2019. The event was an expansive panel of discussion about arts, theatre and where accessibility and the disability community fit in. Does the experience of art performers have to be separate from diversity and inclusion?
